Opening: Scout Rush mixed with Spearmen. You can make Spears in Dark Age, so send a couple forward early for pressure, then follow up with Scouts.
Castle Age: Get to Castle Age quickly and build Fortified Churches for Relic control with Warrior Priests. Play Knights initially, then transition to unique units, Champions, or Halberdiers.
Key Tip 1: Dark Age Spears give early pressure before Scouts even arrive
Key Tip 2: Relic control with Warrior Priests is your primary Castle Age objective
Key Tip 3: Fortified Churches are the key power spike — rush to them

Opening: Eagle Warrior + one Archery Range. Go Eagles + Skirmishers vs. Archer civs, or Eagles + Archers vs. other civs.
Castle Age: Eagle Warrior + Pikeman + Monks. The Eagle-Monk composition is extremely strong with Aztecs.
Key Tip 1: Infantry-heavy play is the way to go
Key Tip 2: Eagle + Monk is the best Castle Age composition for Aztecs by far
Key Tip 3: Mix Eagles with the correct Range unit depending on what you face

Opening: Scout Rush or Archer Rush. Avoid infantry — you want to make use of the extra 2 Villagers you get in Feudal Age with a fast Feudal into a solid opening.
Castle Age: If you went Scouts, transition to Light Cav + Monks (no Knights available). If Archers, go into Crossbow or Elephant Archers. Monk play is huge with this civ.
Key Tip 1: Fast Feudal to capitalize on the extra Villagers
Key Tip 2: Don't make Knights in Castle Age — use Light Cav or Monks instead
Key Tip 3: No Thumb Ring, but Archers into Crossbow still works well
Key Tip 4: Monks are essential with Bengalis

Opening: Scout Rush. This gives you the best flexibility to transition into Camel Archer, Genitour, or Stable units (Knights, Camels, Light Cav).
Castle Age: Camel Archer + Genitour is the ideal composition. The Stable also gives access to Bloodlines and Husbandry for these units.
Key Tip 1: Berbers don't get many Feudal Age bonuses — play passively
Key Tip 2: You really pop off from Castle Age onwards
Key Tip 3: Camel Archer is your best unit — get to it through the Stable opening

Opening: Archers and Spears. Play a passive Feudal Age and aim to reach Castle Age as fast as possible.
Castle Age: Chemistry Crossbow or Hand Cannoneers. Free gold and stone mining techs smooth out your economy. Hand Cannoneers in Castle Age are extremely strong.
Key Tip 1: Passive Feudal is ideal — your civ comes online in Castle Age
Key Tip 2: Free mining techs give you a smooth economy
Key Tip 3: Hand Cannoneers in Castle Age is probably the best strategy

Opening: One-range Archer opening. Play a relatively passive Feudal Age. Sometimes mix in Militia or Scouts, but Archers are the priority.
Castle Age: Extra-range Crossbow + cheaper Town Centers. This sets you up perfectly for the rest of the game.
Key Tip 1: Archers as much as possible is the ideal strategy
Key Tip 2: Goal is to reach Castle Age where your range bonus and cheaper TCs kick in
Key Tip 3: Simple effective gameplan — don't overcomplicate it

Opening: Men-at-Arms rush. Free Men-at-Arms upgrade makes this very effective. Follow up with a quick Range + Blacksmith or Stable for continued pressure.
Castle Age: Krepost rush with heavy army presence. Make the game as messy as possible while maintaining map control for forward Kreposts.
Key Tip 1: Free Men-at-Arms makes the rush extremely cost-effective
Key Tip 2: Lots of army in Feudal Age is the way to go
Key Tip 3: Map control is crucial for setting up forward Kreposts
Key Tip 4: Keep the game messy and aggressive

Opening: The 'nothing' opening. Go up to Feudal and wall up with maybe a Stable or a couple Spears. Play as defensive as possible — pick up Bow Saw and Heavy Plow.
Castle Age: Light Cavalry + Monks or Cavalier + Monks for Relic control. The more passive your Feudal, the more your eco techs pay off.
Key Tip 1: Passive Feudal is the best Feudal for Burgundians
Key Tip 2: Picking up Relics is the #1 gameplan
Key Tip 3: Once you get Relics, the game becomes very easy to win
Key Tip 4: Early eco tech advantage compounds over time

Opening: Two Militia Feudal drush (Dark Age rush). Takes advantage of +1 attack in Feudal and the strong economy without over-investing like Men-at-Arms would.
Castle Age: Follow up with a Range or Stable and play a standard game. The early drush gives a small punch without heavy commitment.
Key Tip 1: +1 attack makes Militia surprisingly effective in Dark/Feudal
Key Tip 2: Two Militia drush is less investment than Men-at-Arms
Key Tip 3: Lets you transition smoothly into Range or Stable play

Opening: Skirmisher + Spearman rush. These are your discounted counter units — lean into them.
Castle Age: Continue with Elite Skirmisher + Pikeman, or switch to Camels. Keep using discounted counter units while developing your economy toward Imperial Age.
Key Tip 1: Discounted counter units are your bread and butter
Key Tip 2: Develop economy behind cheap Skirm/Spear pressure
Key Tip 3: Goal is to reach Imperial Age where Byzantines are very strong

Opening: Two Militia Feudal drush, then transition to Ranges. Being on Ranges (Archers or Skirms) is the best way to take advantage of the wood bonus.
Castle Age: Ranges set up nicely for Siege play. Alternatively, go Stable into Knights + Siege, but without Bloodlines you'd need a committed push.
Key Tip 1: Wood bonus shines when you're on Range units
Key Tip 2: Two Militia drush is less investment than Men-at-Arms
Key Tip 3: Range play naturally transitions into strong Siege in Castle Age
Key Tip 4: If going Knights, commit to an all-in since you lack Bloodlines

Opening: Scout Rush. Most flexible and versatile opening. Survive the early Feudal Age and let your extra Villagers pay off — you'll be ahead by default.
Castle Age: Anything — the Scout opening keeps all options open. Chinese have one of the most flexible tech trees in the game.
Key Tip 1: Scouts is the most versatile strategy, perfect for Chinese
Key Tip 2: Just survive early Feudal and your extra Vills do the rest
Key Tip 3: Flexibility is the Chinese strength — adapt to your opponent

Opening: Second Town Center in Feudal Age. If you can do this uncontested, you will almost certainly win. Sometimes you need Archers, a Stable, or Spears to survive.
Castle Age: The 2 TC boom will put you massively ahead going into Castle Age.
Key Tip 1: 2 TC in Feudal is the absolute best Cuman strategy
Key Tip 2: As long as you survive and stabilize on 2 TCs, you'll be fine
Key Tip 3: Do whatever is needed to defend the 2 TC play
Key Tip 4: If uncontested, it's basically a guaranteed win

Opening: Two-range opening with a mix of Archers and Skirmishers. Best way to use the 200 extra wood and faster-firing Skirms. Add Spears if worried about Scouts.
Castle Age: Continue pressuring. Take advantage of the power spike from extra wood per age.
Key Tip 1: Put as much pressure as possible to use your early power spike
Key Tip 2: Two Ranges gets the most value from the 200 starting wood
Key Tip 3: Faster-firing Skirms are a nice bonus in the mix
Key Tip 4: Pressure is key — Dravidians want to be aggressive

Opening: One-range Archers, then wait for Castle Age.
Castle Age: Crossbow into whatever composition you need. Alternatively, Crossbow + one Stable Knight + forward Siege for an all-in push.
Key Tip 1: Straightforward Archer civ — Archers into Crossbow
Key Tip 2: Ethiopian Crossbow is very strong
Key Tip 3: Can mix in Knights and Siege for a deadly Castle Age push

Opening: Scouts. The classic Frank opening.
Castle Age: Knights, and eventually Paladin. Scouts into Knights into Paladin is the dream.
Key Tip 1: Scouts into Knights is the best gameplan for Franks
Key Tip 2: Sometimes you need to mix in Skirmishers against counter units
Key Tip 3: Keep it simple — Cavalry is what Franks do best

Opening: Fast up into Scout Rush. Take advantage of healing Scouts aggressively.
Castle Age: Develop economy and get to Monaspa as soon as possible. Mass them while building up economy with Churches and Town Centers.
Key Tip 1: Healing Scouts are very powerful — use them aggressively
Key Tip 2: Monaspa is the key unit — rush to Castle Age for them
Key Tip 3: Monaspa currently has no generic counter (may be nerfed in future patches)
Key Tip 4: Economy + mass Monaspa = win condition

Opening: Two Militia drush or Men-at-Arms, taking advantage of the extra hunt bonus. Alternatively, Scouts + Spearmen — cheaper Spears are great in Scout wars.
Castle Age: Infantry-heavy play. Use the cheaper infantry discount which scales through the ages.
Key Tip 1: Infantry openings capitalize on your bonuses
Key Tip 2: Scouts + Spears is equally good — cheaper Spears shine in Scout mirrors
Key Tip 3: Extra hunt bonus helps sustain aggressive openings

Opening: One-range Archer opening. Don't be tempted by Scouts or Camels in Feudal.
Castle Age: Crossbow + Camel. This is an insane composition and the best way to play Gurjaras.
Key Tip 1: Crossbow + Camel in Castle Age is the target composition
Key Tip 2: Archers in Feudal set up the Crossbow transition perfectly
Key Tip 3: Resist the urge to go Scouts/Camels early — Archers are better

Opening: Scout Rush and stay flexible. Two main follow-ups: switch to Archers for aggressive building pressure, or go into Camels/Light Cav.
Castle Age: Scouts + Archers can break into opponent's base using the bonus damage to buildings. Or transition to Camels/Light Cav for a standard game.
Key Tip 1: Scouts doing more damage to buildings synergizes with Archer follow-up
Key Tip 2: Scouts into Archers can win the game in Feudal Age
Key Tip 3: Scouts into Camels/Light Cav is the safer alternative
Key Tip 4: Stay flexible and read what your opponent is doing

Opening: Scout Rush. Opens the door to all of the best Hun units in Castle Age.
Castle Age: Cavalry Archers or Light Cavalry/Knights. Having the Stable makes your opponent guess your transition.
Key Tip 1: Scouts into CA or Scouts into Light Cav — both are excellent
Key Tip 2: Don't go Archers into CA — being on Range units all game lets opponent counter with Skirms
Key Tip 3: The mind game of Stable → CA or Stable → Knights is crucial
Key Tip 4: Wall up after Scouts to keep your opponent guessing

Opening: Eagle Warrior + Range units. Best combo is Eagles + Skirmishers since you get a discount on food units. Eagles + Spears is also good.
Castle Age: Very flexible — Incas can do almost anything in Castle Age.
Key Tip 1: Eagles + Skirms or Skirms + Spears are the best Feudal combos
Key Tip 2: Food unit discount makes Eagles and Spears very cost-effective
Key Tip 3: Pick your opening based on the matchup
Key Tip 4: Castle Age flexibility is a major Inca strength

Opening: Scout Rush or one-range Archers. Both are equally good and lead to strong Castle Age units.
Castle Age: Fully upgraded Knights or fully upgraded Crossbows — either works. Very versatile civ.
Key Tip 1: Don't play infantry — it slows down your Castle Age timing
Key Tip 2: Faster Castle Age is your best advantage
Key Tip 3: Both Scouts and Archers lead to excellent Castle Age options
Key Tip 4: Italians are more versatile than people think

Opening: Men-at-Arms into fast Range transition. Japanese have a weaker late game so try to gain advantages early.
Castle Age: Range units are the best mid-game option — Crossbow, Skirmisher, or Cavalry Archer. CA is particularly strong.
Key Tip 1: Try to end the game as early as possible
Key Tip 2: Japanese late game is relatively weak
Key Tip 3: Ranges in mid-game are the best way to use the civ
Key Tip 4: Cavalry Archers especially scale well for Japanese

Opening: Scout Rush + full wall. You don't have a Barracks, so you can't make Spearmen against enemy Scouts — walls are essential for defense.
Castle Age: Scouts into Knights, Light Cav, or more Scouts. Farms work insanely fast and don't need drop-off, so your food economy is incredible.
Key Tip 1: Full wall is critical since you can't make Spears
Key Tip 2: Use houses to stay safe during the Scout Rush
Key Tip 3: Super-fast Farms give you an insane food economy
Key Tip 4: Scouts into Knights or continued Scouts are both great

Opening: Spear + Skirmisher or one-range Archers. Don't play Scouts or infantry — they slow you down.
Castle Age: Continue with wood-heavy units. Mix in Towers or Siege. The wood discount means you want as many wood units as possible.
Key Tip 1: Spam wood units to maximize the wood discount
Key Tip 2: Don't waste time on Scouts or infantry
Key Tip 3: Scale into the mid-late game with cheap wood units
Key Tip 4: Towers and Siege complement your strategy well in Castle Age

Opening: Scouts, or Spear + Skirmisher (even a forward Spear/Skirm rush). All are good openings.
Castle Age: Get 2 Relics with multiple Monasteries. Play CA + Knight, or Light Cav — whatever supports Relic control. Stay on 1 TC while fighting for Relics, then boom after.
Key Tip 1: Getting 2 Relics in Castle Age is the #1 priority
Key Tip 2: Consider 2 Monasteries to speed up Relic collection
Key Tip 3: Stay on 1 TC while fighting for Relics, add TCs after
Key Tip 4: Relics power up your Knights significantly

Opening: Scout Rush. Cheaper Scouts + free Forging makes this opening insane. Go Scouts in 99% of cases.
Castle Age: Light Cav/Knights or Cavalry Archers. Both scale extremely well, similar to Huns.
Key Tip 1: Cheaper Scouts + free Forging = best Scout Rush in the game
Key Tip 2: Almost never deviate from Scouts as your opening
Key Tip 3: Light Cav/Knights or CA are equally strong Castle Age options

Opening: Two Militia Feudal drush. Free infantry armor means Militia only take 2 damage from Villagers, making them obnoxious to deal with. Add Spears too.
Castle Age: Stick with Elephants or Range/Infantry units. Avoid Cavalry — it doesn't work well with Malay.
Key Tip 1: Free armor makes the 2 Militia drush extremely effective
Key Tip 2: Don't go Men-at-Arms — too fragile of a civ for that investment
Key Tip 3: Sending Spears forward with the drush compounds the free armor value
Key Tip 4: Avoid Cavalry in Castle Age — focus on Elephants or Range units

Opening: One-range Archers. The faster you use gold units, the more you benefit from the gold mining bonus.
Castle Age: Crossbow + as many gold units as possible. The gold bonus rewards you for spending gold aggressively.
Key Tip 1: Gold unit spam maximizes your gold mining bonus
Key Tip 2: Don't be tempted by Scouts — Archers get you on gold faster
Key Tip 3: More gold units = more advantage from the bonus

Opening: Eagles + Archers. Cheaper Archers make this the ideal combo (similar to Aztecs/Incas but with Archers instead of Skirms).
Castle Age: Crossbow is the priority. Boom toward Imperial Age where you can play with all kinds of gold units. Plumed Archers are the dream.
Key Tip 1: Eagles + Archers is the best Feudal combination
Key Tip 2: Cheaper Archers give great value
Key Tip 3: Goal is to boom into Imperial on Plumed Archers/Crossbow
Key Tip 4: Mayans want to reach Imperial Age

Opening: Scout Rush. Can also try a cheesy Fast Castle into Steppe Lancers (high risk/high reward).
Castle Age: Steppe Lancers are absolutely busted for Mongols right now. Scouts into Steppe Lancers is insane. Alternatively CA or Mangudai.
Key Tip 1: Scouts into Steppe Lancers is the best current strategy
Key Tip 2: FC Steppe Lancers is a strong cheese option
Key Tip 3: CA or Mangudai are the backup options
Key Tip 4: Just open Scouts and you'll have a good time with Mongols

Opening: Scout Rush into Knights, Camels, or Light Cav.
Castle Age: Continue with Cavalry units and boom toward late game. Persian CA sounds appealing but Parthian Tactics is expensive in Castle Age and the bonus isn't strong enough.
Key Tip 1: Cavalry units are the way to go — don't bother with CA
Key Tip 2: Boom toward Savars in the late game
Key Tip 3: Keep it simple with Stable units

Opening: Scout Rush + wall, or Tower Rush. Tower Rush is arguably the best opening if the map supports it. Otherwise, Scout + wall to secure your farms.
Castle Age: Boom and all-in Knights with the unique tech. Securing Folwark farms is the #1 economic priority.
Key Tip 1: Tower Rush is extremely effective if the map allows it
Key Tip 2: Scouts + walls is the safer alternative
Key Tip 3: Securing 4+ Folwark farms is the key economic strategy
Key Tip 4: All-in Knights with Szlachta Privileges is the Castle Age play

Opening: One-range Archers. Make as many gold units as possible to take advantage of the gold discount.
Castle Age: Crossbow into Crossbow + Knight or Crossbow + Siege. Gold units are always the priority.
Key Tip 1: Gold units are always the priority — maximize the discount
Key Tip 2: Can open with a couple Militia for a small discount benefit, but Archers are better
Key Tip 3: Similar philosophy to Malians — spam gold units

Opening: Scout Rush. Men-at-Arms + infantry armor is tempting but overcommits to Feudal Age and is easy to stop with Ranges.
Castle Age: Transition from Scouts to Longswords. Scout + Spear opening lets you farm efficiently and opens up options.
Key Tip 1: Scout Rush takes better advantage of Roman economy
Key Tip 2: Infantry opening is overrated — easy to counter
Key Tip 3: Scouts into infantry transition in Castle Age is the ideal path

Opening: One-range Archers. Don't use infantry. Build a Market and aim for a fast Castle Age.
Castle Age: Archer + Siege push to break walls (bonus damage vs. buildings), or Crossbow + Camels. Camel HP bonus makes them dominant vs. Cavalry in early Castle.
Key Tip 1: Crossbow + Camel is almost an auto-win vs. Cavalry civs
Key Tip 2: Siege push with wall-breaking bonus is an alternative win condition
Key Tip 3: Market helps you reach Castle Age faster
Key Tip 4: Saracens are very strong right now

Opening: Fast Castle into Serjeants. Cut Villager production, build a Donjon, and send Serjeants forward to build more Donjons in the enemy base.
Castle Age: Serjeant + Donjon forward is the deadliest opening. Standard alternative is Scouts + Spears for farming with Horse Collar, but it's much weaker.
Key Tip 1: FC Serjeant is the best strategy by far
Key Tip 2: Serjeants building Donjons in the enemy base is devastating
Key Tip 3: The standard Scouts + Spears opening is serviceable but nowhere near as strong
Key Tip 4: Commit to the cheese — it's the Sicilian strength

Opening: Scout Rush. Most flexible opening and farming bonus means you benefit from early farms.
Castle Age: Longswords (free Supplies + Gambesons) or Cavalry + Siege. Monks move faster, so Monks + Cavalry is a great combo.
Key Tip 1: Scouts let you farm faster with the farming bonus
Key Tip 2: Only go Ranges for defensive Skirmishers — otherwise stick to Cav or Infantry
Key Tip 3: Faster Monks + Cavalry is a strong combo
Key Tip 4: Longswords with free Supplies and Gambesons are surprisingly effective

Opening: Flexible — Scouts, Spear + Skirm, or even Archers all work. Treat Feudal as a transition period.
Castle Age: Get Conquistadors ASAP. Conqs + Monks/Missionaries or Conqs + Mangonel is a deadly Castle Age push.
Key Tip 1: Conquistadors are your best unit — rush to them
Key Tip 2: Feudal Age is just a bridge to Castle Age Conqs
Key Tip 3: Secure Stone for a Castle to produce Conqs
Key Tip 4: Conqs + Missionaries is a terrifying push

Opening: Scout Rush. Transition into Cavalry Archers (free Thumb Ring makes them insane) or Stable units (Steppe Lancers, Camels, Light Cav, Knights).
Castle Age: Cavalry Archers are the best scaling option. Stable units are also strong. Free Thumb Ring CA is the priority.
Key Tip 1: Scouts into CA is the ideal path — free Thumb Ring is huge
Key Tip 2: Stable options are equally viable as a backup
Key Tip 3: One-range Archers into Thumb Ring Crossbow is the third best option
Key Tip 4: CA scales much better than Crossbow for Tatars

Opening: Tower Rush. Free Murder Holes in Castle Age + garrison bonus makes Towers extremely strong. Sets up forward pressure without relying on mobility.
Castle Age: Established forward pressure from towers. Less reliant on mobility (no Husbandry). If not tower rushing, open Archers — cheaper Farms make the Range opening smooth.
Key Tip 1: Tower Rush is the ideal opening — covers the mobility weakness
Key Tip 2: Free Murder Holes is a huge Castle Age power spike for towers
Key Tip 3: If you don't tower rush, Archers are better than Scouts (no Husbandry)
Key Tip 4: Cheaper Farms + Archer opening develops your base smoothly

Opening: Scouts (play like Huns — into CA, Light Cav, Knight, or Camel), or one-range Archers (play like Saracens — into Archer + Camel or Archer + Light Cav).
Castle Age: Either Scouts into CA/Cavalry, or Archers into Archers + Camel/Light Cav. Both are equally good. Gunpowder is for specific scenarios only.
Key Tip 1: Two equally good paths: Scouts route or Archers route
Key Tip 2: Gold mining bonus supports either approach
Key Tip 3: Generic units and strategies are better than rushing to gunpowder
Key Tip 4: Save gunpowder for when the situation specifically calls for it

Opening: Scouts into Skirmishers, or Spear + Skirm, or Scouts into Cavalry Archers. Not straight Archers despite being an Archer civ.
Castle Age: CA with extra HP feels amazing. Skirms are also strong. Avoid being stuck on pure Crossbow — no Camel to back them up.
Key Tip 1: Don't default to one-range Archers — it's a trap with Vietnamese
Key Tip 2: Scouts into Skirms or Scouts into CA are both better
Key Tip 3: Straight Archers leaves you stuck on Crossbow with no Camel support
Key Tip 4: Extra HP CA in Castle Age is very strong

Opening: Two Militia Feudal drush. Extra HP on infantry + early pressure lets you seed farms behind it. Play a passive Feudal after the drush.
Castle Age: Economy-focused Castle Age. Pull ahead with free Wheelbarrow and Hand Cart. Aim for a faster Imperial Age timing.
Key Tip 1: Drush into passive boom is the ideal Viking gameplan
Key Tip 2: Free Wheelbarrow and Hand Cart give a massive economic edge
Key Tip 3: Goal is to reach Imperial Age faster than your opponent
Key Tip 4: Vikings' late game is weak — win with the early Imperial timing
